column4: alright, wtf? i installed the new update and now my xserver wont start.
yeah, its xserver-xorg-core
i dont use the fglrx
i have an ati 7500 - the fglrx module doesnt work on it
but the new update definately screwed up X
I was just using the radeon driver and had acceleration .. dont know whats up with it now
Ok, how do I just roll back to the previous xorg core version?
thanks
is 'no devices deteced' same as 'no screens found'?

you can type 'sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-core=1:1.0.2-0ubuntu10.4' to upgrade to the correct version (provided the mirror is upto date, else wait), or 'sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-core=1:1.0.2-0ubuntu10' to downgrade
So whats the deal with this? Is it going to be fixed, or do I have to just ignore that it wants to update?
it's already been fixed, it's just a question of when yourm irror gets 10.4
I'm not complaining, this is the first glitch I've had with Ubuntu, but I'm curious what happened.
well, a security update messed up things in xorg, and as such they rolled back to the older version, under a new version number, 10.4
And how do u do that?
well, I test a update on one computer, if it works fine, I stick it on the lan's repository, and get the updates shiped out to the other computers.
In this case wasnt the bug isolated to a particular subset of systems? How would u know for sure?
most of the hardware getting the updates is very similar to the test computer.
I use the same update practices with windows :)
Ah. I c. Well, I'm glad there are people around who are in the know and willing to help the community at large.
Like yourself.
the issue was found before I even discovered it, so I didn't really help much other than on the channel :P
Well, every little bit helps, you know? Most of these guys have switched from Windows and wouldn't know a cl from a hole in the wall.
